name: Garden
description:
This is a scene from an Indian garden during the Mughals times when kings built beautiful gardens for their queens. These royal women would then spend their evenings simply picking flowers with their sahelis or friends or just sit and admire the passage of dusk.

Physical copies in high quality Giclée print on canvas paper will be sent on purchase.
Free Shipping within India.
7% from sales will go to support the #savesoil movement by Isha Foundation to combat soil degradation and climate change.
